H0.text: Heat is the form in which plants store energy.

H1.text: Light is the form in which plants store energy.

H2.text: Chemical is the form in which plants store energy.

H3.text: Mechanical is the form in which plants store energy.

A4.text: Photosynthetic organisms store the converted chemical energy within the bonds of intracellular organic compounds (complex compounds containing carbon), typically carbohydrates like sugars (mainly glucose, fructose and sucrose), starches, phytoglycogen and cellulose.

A5.text: Plants synthesize carbohydrates from carbon dioxide and water by photosynthesis storing the absorbed energy internally, often in the form of starch or lipids.
